label: 本田和気尊
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Homuta wake no mikoto (J.) 本田和気尊, often pronounced Honda wake no mikoto. This kami, the main object of veneration at Usa Hachimang・ was viewed as the spirit of the semi-legendary sovereign Ōjin (r. 270-310). By the early 9th c., this kami was also identified as the bodhisattva Hachiman (Hachiman daibosatsu).
